subtitle: paper 135 john the baptist
john the baptist was born march 25th 7
bc
in accordance with the promise that
gabriel made to elizabeth in june of the
previous year
for five months elizabeth kept secret
gabriel's visitation
and when she told her husband zacharias
he was greatly troubled and fully
believed her narrative only after he had
an unusual dream about six weeks before
the birth of john
accepting the visit of gabriel to
elizabeth and the dream of zacharias
there was nothing unusual or
supernatural connected with the birth of
john the baptist
on the eighth day john was circumcised
according to the jewish custom
he grew up as an ordinary child day by
day and year by year
in the small village known those days as
the city of judah
about four miles west of jerusalem the
most eventful occurrence in john's early
childhood was the visit
in company with his parents to jesus and
the nazareth family
this visit occurred in the month of june
1 bc
when he was a little over 6 years of age
after the return from nazareth john's
parents began the systematic education
of the lad
there was no synagogue school in this
little village
however as he was a priest zacharias was
fairly well educated
and elizabeth was far better educated
than the average judean woman
she was also the priesthood being a
descendant of the daughters of aaron
since john was the only child they spent
a great deal of time on his mental and
spiritual training
zacharias had only short periods of
service at the temple in jerusalem
so that he devoted much of his time to
teaching his son
zacharias and elizabeth had a small farm
in which they raised sheep
they hardly made a living on this land
but zacharias received a regular
allowance
from the temple funds dedicated to the
priesthood
john becomes a nazarite john had no
school from which to graduate at the age
of 14
but his parents had selected this as the
appropriate year for him to take the
formal
nazarite vow accordingly zacharias and
elizabeth took their son to engetti
down by the dead sea this was the
southern headquarters of the nazarite
brotherhood
and there the lad was duly and solemnly
inducted into this order for life
after these ceremonies in the making of
the vows to abstain from all
intoxicating drinks
to let the hair grow and to refrain from
the touching the dead
the family proceeded to jerusalem where
before the temple
john completed the making of the
offering which were required of those
taking nazarite vows
john took the same life vows that had
been administered to his illustrious
predecessors
samson and the prophet samuel a life
nazarite was looked upon as a sanctified
and holy personality
the jews regarded a nazarite with almost
the respect and veneration accorded the
high priest
and this was not strange since nazarites
of lifelong consecration
were the only persons except high priest
who were ever permitted to enter the
holy of holies in the temple
john returned home from jerusalem to
tend his father sheep
and grew up to be a strong man with a
noble character
when 16 years old john as a result of
reading about elijah
became greatly impressed with the
prophet of mount carmel and decided to
adopt his style of dress
from that day on john always wore a
hairy garment with a leather girdle
at 16 he was more than six feet tall and
almost full grown
with his flowing hair and peculiar mode
of dress he was indeed a picturesque
youth
and his parents expected great things of
this their only son
a child of promise and a nazarite for
life
the death of zacharias after an illness
of several months zacharias died in july
ad 12
when john was past 18 years of age this
was a time of great embarrassment to
john since the nazarite vow forbade
contact with the dead
even in one's own family although john
had endeavored to comply with the
restrictions of his vow regarding
contamination by the dead
he doubted that he had been wholly
obedient to the requirements of the
nazirite order
therefore after his father's burial he
went to jerusalem
where in the nazarite corner of the
woman's court he offered the sacrifice
required for his cleansing
in september of this year elizabeth and
john made a journey to nazareth to visit
mary and jesus
john had just about made up his mind to
launch out into his life work
but he was admonished not only by jesus
words
but also by example to return home take
care of his mother and await the coming
of the father's hour
after bidding jesus and mary goodbye at
the end of his enjoyable visit
john did not again see jesus until the
event of his baptism in the jordan
john elizabeth returned to their home
and began to lay plans for the future
since john refused to accept the priests
allowance due to him from the temple
funds
by the end of the two years they had all
but lost their home
so they decided to go south with the
sheepherd
accordingly the summer that john was 20
years of age witnessed their removal to
hebron
in the so-called wilderness of judea
john tended his sheep along a brook that
was a tributary
to a larger stream which entered the
dead sea at and getty
the engetti colony included not only
nazarites of lifelong and time period
consecration
but numerous other aesthetic herdsmen
who congregated in this region
with their herds and fraternized with
the nazarite brotherhood
they supported themselves by sheep
raising it from gifts with wealthy
jews made to their order as time passed
john returned less often to hebron
while he made more frequent visits to
engetti
he was so entirely different from the
majority of the nazarites
that he found it very difficult fully to
fraternize with the brotherhood
but he was very fond of abner the
acknowledged leader and head of the
engetti colony
the life of a shepherd along the valley
of this little brook john built no less
than a dozen stone shelters and night
corrals
consisting of piled up stones wherein he
could watch over and safeguard his herds
of sheep and goats
john's life as a shepherd afforded him a
great deal of time for thought
he talked much with esda an orphan lad
of bathur
whom he had in a way adopted and who
cared for the herds when he made trips
to hebron
to see his mother into saul sheep as
well as when he went down to and getty
for sabbath services
john and the lad lived very simply
substituting on mutton
goat's milk wild honey and the edible
locusts of that region
this their regular diet was supplemented
by provisions brought from hebron
and in getty from time to time elizabeth
kept john posted about palestine world
affairs
and his conviction grew deeper and
deeper that the time was fast
approaching when the old order was to
end
that he was to become the herald of the
approach of a new age
the kingdom of heaven this rugged
shepherd was very partial to the writing
of the prophet daniel
he read a thousand times daniel's
description of the great image
which zechariah said told him
represented the history of the great
kingdoms of the world
beginning with babylon then persia
greece and finally rome
john perceived that already was rome

consolidated empire
he believed that rome was even then
divided as syria
egypt palestine and other provinces and
then he further read
in the days of these kings shall the god

which shall never be destroyed and this

people
but shall break in pieces and consume

and it shall stand forever and there was
given him dominion and glory in the

his dominion is an everlasting dominion

and the kingdom and dominion and the

heaven
shall be given to the people of the
saints of the most high
whose kingdom is an everlasting kingdom

in daniel he read i saw in the night

one like the son of man came with the

mother assured him that his distant

john was to become his advanced herald

from what he knew of the evil doing of

he was minded to believe that the end of

it seemed to this rugged and noble child

the feeling grew in john's heart that he

men
repent get right with god get ready for

the kingdom of heaven
